title: Fixed it again!
comment: Check the location of your keepass db file if you are having problems getting this to work. I think it has to do with (new?) limitations on file access in Android. Moving the db to new location solved crashes.

title: Suddenly stop working with keepass
comment: It was working perfectly for the whole year then it simply fail to launch keepass since last month... Got a toaster saying it launch but nothing happened.

title: Stopped working.
comment: It worked for a while, but now it doesn't. Now when I use my tag, a "Searching for KeePass..." message appears for a second, and after that nothing happens. Not even an error message. Keepass2Android Offline is installed (it works fine by manually typing the password). I tried rewriting the tag, reinstalling NFC Key, nothing helped. Can you, please, provide detailed error messages in your app for this situation (in the next release), so at least I can guess what is the problem?

title: Works!
comment: Works well on Android 4.4. Takes a hassle out of unlocking the KeePass database.  Opening the database from Dropbox.

title: Database location in Gdrive incorrect.
comment: After selecting from within the app (version: 1.40 d.d. October 15, 2014) the location of a Keepass 2.28 database on Google Drive (optionally marked as "Keep on this device"), the location variable of the field shows only the value "/", instead of what perhaps (!) should be something like: "gdrive://<google_account>/<location/<filename>.kdbx". Using Keepass2Android Password Safe (online) version 0.9.4 d.d. June 13, 2014. However, this gives the error that the path is incorrect. BTW: Accessing files on Google Drive marked as "Keep on this device" via a filemanager on the phone is not an option, since such files are encrypted and read only.
I'm working on a solution of this problem. Please be patient.

title: Crashes when trying to open a DB from google Drive
comment: Was able to test with a new file on the local file system, but the app crashes when trying to open a file from google drive. It would be also nice if it could use any arbitrary NFC tag with non-NFCKey data on it as a key (use the tag's serial number as a key for instance).

title: Google drive
comment: Whenever I choose google drive it doesn't write the tag.
I'm working on a solution of this problem. Please be patient.

title: NFC Key has great promise
comment: and it might work as advertised, but being new to NFC protocols, I have had nothing but frustration trying to get it set up and working.  Might be a great app, but desperately needs some step by step guidance for the newbies like me.  For now, only two stars.  Hope some documentation is coming...

There is almost nothing to setup. You must choose database for KeePass, password and simply write data to tag, by clicking button and moving phone near to the NFC TAG. After that, close my app and simply move phone near to previously programmed tag, and... that's all :) 
NO NFC knowledge is needed :)
